actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to repeal the requirement that officers of organizations or groups sponsoring foreign business related meetings verify certain activities of individuals attending such meetings.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal the requirement that officers of an organization which sponsored a business convention in a foreign country for which a taxpayer is claiming an income tax deduction with respect to expenses incurred in attending such convention submit a written statement verifying the schedule of business activities conducted at the convention and the attendance of the taxpayer at such activities.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to repeal the requirement that officers of organizations or groups sponsoring foreign business related meetings verify certain activities of individuals attending such meetings.
